page.title: 06FARMING
page.content: There are two different types of farm in the area: fruit and dairy with residual crops for feed. DAIRY FARMS: ROUSE FARM has 67 acres of land - mainly Friesians, a few shorthorns and 2 Ayrshires. They feed the cows with sown grass which produces 150 bales an acre. This farm buys in straw. To keep therd up young are reared out of the 30 best cows, the others are inseminated by a hereford bull. 10-12 heifers are reared each yesr. They produce annually 5,500 kilos of milk per cow, 3.7% butter fat and 3.7% protien.
